intro: Parabaena elmeri var. philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine parabaena, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
